actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-72, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H. Res. 101 and H. Res. 146. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Upon adoption of H. Res. 158, it shall be in order to consider in the House, any rule of the House to the contrary notwithstanding, H. Res. 101. The resolution shall be debatable for not to exceed two hours, equally divided and controlled by the Chairmen and ranking minority members of the Committees on Ways and Means and Rules. After disposition of H. Res. 101, it shall be in order to consider in the House H. Res. 146. The resolution shall be debatable for not to exceed one hour, to be equally divided and controlled by the Chairmen and ranking minority members of the Committees on Ways and Means and Rules.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 20.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 274 - 148 (Roll no. 114).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for consideration of two resolutions on the subject of "fast track" procedures for consideration of bills to implement trade agreements.

summary.text: Sets forth rules for the debate and consideration of resolutions on fast track procedures for implementation of trade agreements and on U.S. objectives in the negotiations of future trade agreements.

titles.title: Providing for consideration of two resolutions on the subject of "fast track" procedures for consideration of bills to implement trade agreements.
